intro: Trochomeria bussei var. tripartita, commonly known as the three-parted trochomeria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
